Question.Question: 1: UV irradiation impairs ongoing collagen synthesis leading to acute loss of collagen in the skin.
2: When smoking and excessive sun exposure is combined, the effects of smoking on wrinkling are multiplicative.
3: Botulinum toxin is injected sideways next to the muscles causing the wrinkles.

5: Botulinum toxin is not contra-indicated in the presence of infection at the proposed injection site.
6: Prior injection with botulinum toxin over an area with excessive movement does not have an effect on the results and migration of the dermal filler.
7: Chemical peels may result in superficial, moderate-depth or deep skin injury.

Article.Naam: Platelet-rich plasma applications in skin rejuvenation

2: Growth factors located in the platelet are located in the Alpha granules.
3: Platelets are traditionally activated by binding to collagen or vWF on exposed tissue.

Article.Naam: Update on skin needling once a week

2: Because of scar formation, histological studies find signs of damage to the skin up to 60 hours after needling.
3: Intensive needling can be done using topical anaesthesia and post-procedure analgesics.
4: A simple bar of soap usually destabilises the lipid bi-layers of the stratum corneum before topical anaesthesia.
5: With a re-usable Roll-CIT costs can be kept down since it can be used on several clients.

2: There are no clinical data to support the use of topical vitamin C to improve fine lines and reduce inflammation.
